label: 都
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: The term may derive from miyadokoro, meaning the site of the palace." Miyako was certainly used in the eighth century; it appears in eighth-century poems in the Man'yōshū. It may have been used earlier. Perhaps retrospectively, it also appears in the so-called Taika Reform edicts. [宮所、万葉集、大化改新] "
